quote: 6.3% peak during the pandemic in April 2020
issue: April 2020 unemployment was 14.7%, not 6.3% - more than double the claimed figure. Source: bls.gov/opub/ted/2020/unemployment-rate-rises-to-record-high-14-point-7-percent-in-april-2020.htm

quote: 6.3% peak during the pandemic in April 2020
issue: False data - April 2020 unemployment was 14.7%, not 6.3%. Source: bls.gov/opub/ted/2020

quote: The US unemployment rate reached 3.5% in December 2024
issue: BLS data shows 4.1% unemployment in December 2024, not 3.5%. Source: bls.gov/news.release/empsit.nr0.htm

quote: The US unemployment rate reached 3.5% in December 2024
issue: Incorrect statistic - BLS data shows 4.1% unemployment in December 2024. Source: bls.gov

quote: US unemployment rate reached 3.5% in December 2024
issue: Claims December 2024 data when current date is July 2025 - should clarify if referring to past December

quote: Federal Reserve's current federal funds rate is 5.25-5.50%
issue: Fed funds rate was cut to 4.25-4.50% by December 2024. Source: Federal Reserve data

quote: reached 3.5% in December 2024
issue: Claims December 2024 data but it's only July 2025 - data should exist

quote: Inflation, as measured by the Consumer Price Index, was 3.1% year-over-year in November 2024
issue: November 2024 CPI was 2.7% year-over-year, not 3.1%. Source: BLS/CNBC reports

quote: November 2024
issue: References November 2024 data without specifying it's historical (8 months ago from current date)

quote: Inflation, as measured by the Consumer Price Index, was 3.1% year-over-year in November 2024
issue: No source provided; November 2024 CPI data not found. Latest is May 2025 at 2.4%. Source: bls.gov

quote: US working-age population (ages 15-64) is approximately 210 million people
issue: No source provided; 2019 Census shows 213.6M for ages 15-64. No 2024 data found

quote: Labor force participation rate stands at 63.4% as of late 2024
issue: No source provided; BLS shows 62.5% in December 2024, not 63.4%. Source: bls.gov

quote: productivity growth measured 2.3% in the third quarter of 2024
issue: BLS reports 2.2% for Q3 2024, not 2.3%. Source: bls.gov/opub/ted/2024

quote: A recent Stanford study found that remote work increases productivity by 13%
issue: Wrong publication - Ctrip study was in Quarterly Journal of Economics 2015, not AER 2023

quote: published in the American Economic Review in 2023
issue: No such study exists; Stanford 2023 research shows remote work decreases productivity 10-20%

quote: Congressional Budget Office's 2024 economic outlook, GDP growth is projected at 2.1% for 2025
issue: CBO projects 1.9% GDP growth for 2025, not 2.1%. Source: cbo.gov/publication/61172

quote: December 15, 2024
issue: References specific December 2024 date without clarifying it's historical data from 7 months ago

quote: The World Bank estimates global GDP growth at 2.9% for the same period
issue: World Bank cut 2025 forecast to 2.3%, not 2.9%. Source: worldbank.org

quote: November 2024
issue: References November 2024 prices without indicating this is 8-month old data

quote: The S&P 500 closed at 4,750 points on December 15, 2024
issue: No data found; S&P 500 was above 5,800 in December 2024. Source: investing.com

quote: Bitcoin traded at $42,300 as of the same date
issue: Bitcoin was over $100,000 on Dec 15, 2024; $42,300 was Dec 2023 price. Source: statista.com

quote: Oil prices (WTI crude) averaged $78 per barrel in November 2024
issue: WTI crude averaged $69.95 per barrel in November 2024, not $78. Source: Statista/EIA data

quote: Oil prices (WTI crude) averaged $78 per barrel in November 2024
issue: WTI averaged $69.95 in November 2024, not $78. Source: statista.com

quote: closed at 4,750 points on December 15, 2024
issue: Claims specific December 15, 2024 data but it's July 2025 - should be past data

quote: Bitcoin traded at $42,300 as of the same date
issue: Claims December 15, 2024 Bitcoin price but it's July 2025 - should be historical

quote: natural gas futures traded at $2.85 per MMBtu
issue: No source provided; projections showed ~$3.10/MMBtu for November 2024. Source: eia.gov
